newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft sets agressive Net product launch.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft sets agressive Net product launch.

text.p: Microsoft Corp Chief Operating Officer Bob Herbold on Thursday outlined an aggressive rollout of several new Internet-based products and services, speeding its efforts to grab a lion's share of the emmerging market.
"The world is not standing still," Herbold told Reuters following his speech at the Internet Commerce Expo here.
Herbold said Windows 3.1 and Macintosh versions of its new Explorer web browser will be launched in "late fall" of this year.
Moreover, a re-launch of the Microsoft Network On-line service as a comprehensive Web site is now set for mid-October, he said.
Part of that re-launch is a new software package targeted to retailers who want to make Internet shopping easy and secure for consumers.
The software, called Merchant System, already has 200 retailers using it in beta tests, Herbold said.
